intro: Dienia carinata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Dienia carinata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
